thread.title: Amelia defeats Little Miami in OT
thread.title_full: Amelia defeats Little Miami in OT

title: Amelia defeats Little Miami in OT
text:
Amelia defeats Little Miami in OT Cincinnati 10:37 p.m. EDT October 20, 2015 Buy Photo Cody Busam scored two goals in Colerain's 3-2 victory over Withrow Tuesday. (Photo: Community Press file) Buy Photo 
Amelia upset Little Miami 2-1 in overtime in the opening round of the Division I sectional finals. 
Amelia's Scott Ervin scored off a throw-in with three minutes left in the overtime period to send the Barons to the second round. Nic Huber scored midway through the second half in regulation to erase the 1-0 Little Miami lead. 
Amelia will face St. Xavier on Saturday, at 7 p.m. 
Colerain 3, Withrow 2, Division I sectional: Colerain scored a pair of goals in the second half to erase a 2-1 halftime deficit and advance in the Division I sectionals. 
Cody Busam scored two of Colerain's goals and Jacob McGrinder scored the other. Colerain will face Elder on Saturday at 7 p.m. 
La Salle 1, Loveland 0, Division I sectional: Ryan Albrinck scored the game-winner midway through the first half. 
Goalkeeper Nate Logan recorded two saves in the shutout. La Salle will face Sycamore on Saturday, at 7 p.m. 
Carroll 9, Trotwood-Madison 0, Division II sectional: David Austria, Cameron Najarian and David Austria each finished with two goals. Carroll advances to face Meadowdale on Saturday at 7 p.m. 
Milford 3, Talawanda 2, Division I sectional: Milford scored three goals in the first half and held off a late-game Talawanda rally to advance to the second round of the Division I sectionals. 
Nick Glasgow finished with two goals and Oliver Vonderhaar scored the other. Milford will face the winner between Kings and Hamilton on Saturday at 7 p.m. 
Badin 10, Taylor 3, Division II sectional: Cooper Bucalo scored three goals and two assists to lead Badin. 
Badin will face the winner between New Richmond and Fenwick on Saturday at 7 p.m. 
Oak Hills 4, Winton Woods 1, Division I sectional: Benn Hood scored a hat trick to lead Oak Hills. 
Oak Hills advances to face Fairfield on Saturday at 7 p.m. 
Fairfield 2, Harrison 0, Division I sectional: Fairfield shut out Harrison to advance to the second round of the Division I sectionals where they will face Oak Hills. 6 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://cin.ci/1LJLt4p TOP VIDEOS
